Beg se je končal z nesrečo, v avtu tudi dojenček in prebežnika
04 Nov 2019, 06:04 by Sijan Pretnar

Patrulja koprske policijske uprave je v soboto sredi dneva sledila BWM-ju nemške registracije vse od Kozine do Bazovice, kjer se je beg voznika, iraškega državljana, končal z nesrečo. V črnem BMW-ju so bili še njegova žena, njun dojenček in dva ilegalna migranta, ki sta se v trku laže poškodovala.



Slovenski policisti so BMW-ju nemške registracije sledili vse do Bazovice, kjer je trčil v zid in drugo vozilo. Foto: FOTODAMJ@N

KOZINA, BAZOVICA > Policista v civilnem vozilu slovenske policije sta voznika BMW-ja nemške registracije poskušala ustaviti že na Kozini, nam je včeraj potrdila Anita Leskovec, tiskovna predstavnica koprske policijske uprave. Pri semaforiziranem križišču sta nekaj minut pred 13. uro z zvočnimi in svetlobnimi znaki voznika poskušala prepričati, naj avto ustavi. A je z BMW-jem pospešil proti Krvavemu Potoku in nadaljeval z vrtoglavim begom prek mejnega prehoda Pesek. Vse do Bazovice, kjer je voznik zavijal desno, proti Lokvi, a ga je zaneslo, tako da je trčil v avto in zid.
Voznik je po trku zapustil avto in začel bežati, a so ga italijanski policisti, ki so se kmalu pridružili slovenskim kolegom, nedaleč stran prijeli. Po poročanju Primorskega dnevnika se je sopotnica iz BMW-ja poskušala znebiti mobilnega telefona in ga je vrgla na bližnji vrt, a so ga policisti kmalu zatem našli.
Potrdili pa so se tudi sumi slovenskih policistov, da je voznik v avtomobilu nemške registracije prevažal ilegalne prebežnike. Z BMW-jem je bežal 30-letni voznik, državljan Iraka, ki ima urejen status v Nemčiji, z njim sta bila v avtu njegova žena, leto mlajša državljanka Nemčije, in njun komaj dobro leto in pol star dojenček. Peljala pa sta ilegalna migranta, državljana Iraka, stara 19 in 23 let. V nesreči sta se laže poškodovala oba prebežnika, reševalci so ju oskrbeli in odpeljali v bolnišnico Katinara, na opazovanje v otroško bolnišnico pa so odpeljali tudi žensko in otroka.
V nesreči naj bi bila udeležena štiri vozila, v enem od avtomobilov naj bi bili turisti iz Genove, vendar se nihče ni poškodoval. Cesta je bila zaradi nesreče zaprta skoraj do šestih zvečer.

The flight ended in an accident, including a baby and a defector in the car
04 Nov 2019, 06:04 by Sijan Pretnar

A police patrol of the Koper police on Saturday followed BWM German registration all the way from Kozina to Bazovica, where the flight of a driver, an Iraqi citizen, ended in an accident. The black BMW also included his wife, their baby and two illegal migrants who were injured in the crash.



Slovenian police officers followed the German registration of the BMW to Bazovica, where it collided with a wall and another vehicle. Photo: FOTODAMJ @ N

KOZINA, BAZOVICA> Police officers in a civilian vehicle of the Slovenian police tried to stop the drivers of the German German registration at Kozina already, Anita Leskovec, a spokeswoman for the Koper Police Directorate, confirmed to us yesterday. At the traffic light at the intersection, a few minutes before 1pm, they tried to convince the driver to stop the car with the acoustic and light signs of the driver. But he accelerated with BMW towards Bloody Potok and continued his dizzying escape across the Pesek border crossing. All the way to Bazovica, where the driver was turning right, towards Lokva, but he was relieved by colliding with a car and a wall.
The driver left the car after the collision and started to flee, but was captured by Italian police, who soon joined his Slovenian colleagues. According to the Primorska Dnevnik newspaper, a passenger in the BMW tried to get rid of her cellphone and threw it into a nearby garden, but police found it shortly after.
The suspicions of Slovenian police officers also confirmed that the driver was transporting illegal fugitives in a German registration car. A 30-year-old driver, an Iraqi citizen with a German status, was fleeing BMW, with his wife, a young German national, and a barely half-year-old baby in the car. However, illegal migrants, Iraqi citizens, aged 19 and 23, drove by. In the crash, the two fugitives were slightly injured, rescuers were taken and taken to Katinara Hospital, and a woman and a child were taken for observation at the children's hospital.
The crash allegedly involved four vehicles, one of the cars reportedly being tourists from Genoa, but no one was injured. The road was closed due to the accident until almost six in the evening.
